fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives:
Under the EU Treaty, the EU can take action to protect and improve public health, prevent diseases, and identify (cross-border) threats to human health, while fully respecting the responsibilities of the Member States for the organisation and delivery of health services and health care. 
 
As well as EU action in health policy and in the EU Health Programme, many other EU policies and programmes have an impact on health and health systems. Most obviously these include Industrial policies (pharmaceuticals, food, tobacco, polluting industries and products, etc.), Agricultural policy, R&D, Environment, Economic and Employment policies. EPHA adheres to the Governance for Health approach, which means that health impacts should be considered in the impact assessment process for all policy and programme proposals. Regrettably, health impact assessment requirements and guidelines are rarely adhered to in practice.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar

relevant_communication:
According to our 2016-2020 strategic plan, adopted by EPHA members, our current policy priorities include: 
 
- Right to Health and reduction of health inequalities 
- Action on Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) 
- Prevention of chronic diseases (action on food, drink, tobacco, pollutants, etc.) 
- Universal access to affordable medicines 
- EU trade policies for health - in line with the Sustainable Development Goals 
 
In all of EPHA's work we mainstream the following concerns: strengthening and sustainability of European health systems, investing in health and the health workforce, a lifecourse approach (from infancy to old age), parity for mental health, prevention of health threats - both infectious and non-communicable diseases.
goals__remit:
The European Public Health Alliance (EPHA) is an international non-profit association (association international sans but lucratif, AISBL) registered in Belgium.  Our membership is composed of not-for-profit organizations working on all aspects of public health.  We disseminate information to our members on health-related EU policy and legislative initiatives. 
 
EPHA's mission is to bring together the public health community to provide thought leadership and facilitate change; to build public health capacity to deliver equitable solutions to European public health challenges, to improve health and reduce health inequalities. 
 
Our vision is of a Europe with universal good health and well-being, where all have access to a sustainable and high quality health system: A Europe whose policies and practices contribute to health, both within and beyond its borders. 
 
EPHA is committed to transparency about EU interest representation.  EPHA supports the aims and recommendations of Alter-EU to further improve transparency, as described here: https://www.alter-eu.org/what-we-want 
 
We therefore follow the Alter-EU guidelines when completing and updating the Register entry, as described here: https://www.alter-eu.org/documents/2012/04/transparency-register-guidelines
